alert.note: Alert for Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 9:46AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Union County in south central Arkansas and north central Union Parishes through 1045 AM CDT... At 946 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Strong, or 12 miles west of Huttig, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huttig, Strong, Lapile, Urbana, Lawson, Felsenthal, Hillsboro, New London, Cecil, Aurelle, Oakland and Litroe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for south central Arkansas...and north central Louisiana.
